abstracts.cdata!:
The project ratings are as follows :
            Project outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is overall satisfactory; and Borrower
            performance is overall satisfactory.  Among the lessons
            learned are the following:  1) lending can be a powerful
            instrument even for countries that do not need Bank's
            financing for immediate balance of payments or budget
            purposes; 2) An ambitious, complex, and demanding agenda (as
            in the case of SAC-II) seeking to accomplish extensive
            behavioral changes in a transition economy in a short period
            of time necessitates a trusting partnership between the Bank
            team and the Government's counterparts on the one hand;
            and on the other, consistency of advice and coordination of
            efforts amongst multilateral agencies and bilateral donorsl;
            3) Government ownership of policy reforms is a dynamic
            concept; it can reinforce itself or dwindle over time also
            frequent Bank-country dialogue with the continuity and
            dedication of a well-coordinated country team throughout the
            tenure of the program helps to reinforce the
            Government's commitment; and 4) Programmatic assistance
            (as contemplated by the PRSP process) should not be viewed
            just as medium-term and time-bound external support.
            Adjustment operations can play a crucial integrative role in
            paving the way for sector projects in achieving the
            necessary high-level decisions and providing the appropriate
            legal and strategic policy framework.
